info.text:
This tool implements a predictive model of Pedestrian Volume estimated using a Negative Binomial regression method. The volumes estimated cover a 12-hour period (morning to evening).

The model is based on a combination of environmental and demographic factors that showed a relationship with observed levels of pedestrian activity. The model may be applied to road and trail segments. This model is most useful for forecasting the level of activity that would be expected under different conditions. The Negative Binomial model is forced to estimate counts that are zero or greater (unlike the Ordinary Least Squares model), and its results can be compared to collected counts.

The coefficients for the model were estimated by a team from the University of Minnesota (UMN) based on counts collected in Minneapolis, and published by the UMN Center for Transportation Studies in July 2012. The model implementation presented here was developed by the Open Technology Group (Morrisville, NC) under contract with the Federal Highway Administration.

The full report on the study and model development is available in the tool documentation links.
info.name: Pedestrian Volume (Negative Binomial Method, UMN)

links.title: Understanding the Use of Non-Motorized Transportation Facilities (Report)

output.description: You may override the default field name in which results from this tool are reported by entering a different name here.  The name you enter may be adjusted so it is not the same as any fields already in your input data.

elements.description: Field name that will contain 12-hour pedestrian volume
elements.label: Result Field
elements.name: result

output.name: results
output.label: Result Variable

elements.name: Pctnonwhite
elements.description: Percentage of neighborhood residents that are non-white

elements.name: PctU5_O65
elements.description: Percentage of neighborhood residents over 65 or under 5

elements.name: Pctw4ormore
elements.description: Percentage of neighborhood residents with a college education

elements.name: MedHHInc
elements.description: Median household income

elements.name: Crime
elements.description: Average number of violent crimes/year

elements.name: PDperkm2
elements.description: Population density in persons per square kilometer

elements.name: LUMix
elements.description: Measure of mixing of land uses (range 0-1)

elements.name: WatDist_km
elements.description: Distance from nearest body of water, in kilometers

elements.name: CBDdist_km
elements.description: Distance from central business district, kilometers

elements.name: EmployAccess
elements.description: Number of jobs accessible via transit.

elements.name: Principal
elements.description: Principal arterial street (1/0)

elements.name: Arterial
elements.description: Arterial street (1/0)

elements.name: Collector
elements.description: Collector street  (1/0)

elements.name: BusRoute
elements.description: Presence of one of more bus routes (1/0)

elements.name: OffstreetTrail
elements.description: Off-street trail (1/0)

input.description: The indicated properties should be provided for each row of input data.  Omitting a property will result in an incomplete execution of the model as the missing property and its coefficients will be omitted from the model entirely.
input.label: Input File Fields
input.name: data

input.description: These model parameters are the same for each feature, and reflect background conditions that apply to the entire model scenario.  Certain parameters here can be specified either as fields for each input feature, or as global parameters.  You must set the corresponding Input File Field to "Global" in order to use the corresponding value from this section.

elements.name: globalCrime
elements.description: Average number of violent crimes/year

elements.name: globalTmax
elements.description: Recorded daily high temperature (Celsius)

elements.name: globalPrecip
elements.description: Recorded precipitation (cm)

elements.name: globalYear
elements.description: Level variable indicating year count occurred (offset from year 2007)

input.name: global
input.label: Global Parameters

input.description: These are the estimated coefficients for the Negative Binomial Pedestrian hourly volume model. They are presented for reference only and should not be changed without a full model re-estimation.
